thread.title: Oakland Park commissioner resigning
thread.title_full: Oakland Park commissioner resigning - Sun Sentinel

author: Larry Barszewski
title: Oakland Park commissioner resigning
text:
Oakland Park Commissioner Shari McCartney is resigning her seat Oct. 30 for family reasons.
McCartney, who was first elected in 2011 and served as mayor in 2014, made the announcement at Wednesday's commission meeting.
"Since the day I took the seat, it has been my passion and my absolute joy to serve the city of Oakland Park and it remains so," McCartney said. "However, my family and I have made some decisions for a future and as a result I will not be able to continue serving as commissioner."
McCartney, who was re-elected in November, said she will elaborate on her decision at the commission's Oct. 20 meeting.
The charter calls for the commission to appoint a replacement for McCartney until an election, currently planned for March 15, is held, City Clerk Renee Shrout said.
